name: angular-core-annotation
comment: Angular class annotations for Directives, Formatters, and Injectables.

class.name: AttachAware
class.preview: A directives or components may chose to implements angular-core-annotation.AttachAware.angular-core-annotation.AttachAware.attach method. If implemented the method will be called when the next scope digest occurs after component instantiation. It is guaranteed that when angular-core-annotation.AttachAware.attach is invoked, that all attribute mappings have already been processed.

class.name: Component
class.preview: Annotation placed on a class which should act as a controller for the component. Angular components are a light-weight version of web-components. Angular components use shadow-DOM for rendering their templates.

class.name: Controller
class.preview: Annotation placed on a class which should act as a controller for your application.

class.name: Decorator
class.preview: Annotation placed on a class which should act as a directive.

class.name: DetachAware
class.preview: A directives or components may chose to implements angular-core-annotation.DetachAware.angular-core-annotation.DetachAware.detach method. If implemented the method will be called when the next associated scope is destroyed.

class.name: Formatter
class.preview: Use the @angular-core-annotation.Formatter class annotation to identify a class as a formatter.

class.name: Injectable
class.preview: An annotation when applied to a class indicates that the class (service) will be instantiated by di injector. This annotation is also used to designate which classes need to have a static factory generated when using static angular, and therefore is required on any injectable class.

class.name: NgAttr
class.preview: When applied as an annotation on a directive field specifies that the field is to be mapped to DOM attribute with the provided angular-core-annotation.DirectiveAnnotation.attrName. The value of the attribute to be treated as a string, equivalent to @ specification.

class.name: NgCallback
class.preview: When applied as an annotation on a directive field specifies that the field is to be mapped to DOM attribute with the provided angular-core-annotation.DirectiveAnnotation.attrName. The value of the attribute to be treated as a callback expression, equivalent to & specification.

class.name: NgOneWay
class.preview: When applied as an annotation on a directive field specifies that the field is to be mapped to DOM attribute with the provided angular-core-annotation.DirectiveAnnotation.attrName. The value of the attribute to be treated as a one-way expression, equivalent to => specification.

class.name: NgOneWayOneTime
class.preview: When applied as an annotation on a directive field specifies that the field is to be mapped to DOM attribute with the provided angular-core-annotation.DirectiveAnnotation.attrName. The value of the attribute to be treated as a one time one-way expression, equivalent to =>! specification.

class.name: NgTwoWay
class.preview: When applied as an annotation on a directive field specifies that the field is to be mapped to DOM attribute with the provided angular-core-annotation.DirectiveAnnotation.attrName. The value of the attribute to be treated as a two-way expression, equivalent to <=> specification.

class.name: ShadowRootAware
class.preview: Implementing components angular-core-annotation.ShadowRootAware.onShadowRoot method will be called when the template for the component has been loaded and inserted into Shadow DOM. It is guaranteed that when angular-core-annotation.ShadowRootAware.onShadowRoot is invoked, that shadow DOM has been loaded and is ready.
